newsitem.title: USA: Nortel Inversora says plans ADS offering.
newsitem.headline: Nortel Inversora says plans ADS offering.

text.p: Nortel Inversora SA said Friday it plans to offer six million American depositary shares in a secondary offering.
Nortel said its selling shareholders, who invested in the company when it was formed in 1990, will receive all proceeds from the offering.

Nortel's investors include Italy's Stet SpA, France Telecom, Argentine conglomerate Perez Companc SA and J.P. Morgan & Co Inc. Sales by the shareholders will be made on a pro forma basis, Nortel said.
Nortel, which owns 60 percent of Telecom Argentina, said each of the shares represents 1/20th of one of its series B preferred shares.
It said the series B preferred shares are non-voting except in limited circumstances, and can be redeemed at the option of the holders.
The company said underwriters of the offering will be granted an option to buy an additional 900,000 shares to cover over-allotments.
Nortel said it plans to apply to list the shares on the New York Stock Exchange.
The managers for the offering are J.P. Morgan Securities Inc, Credit Suisse First Boston Corp, Lehman Brothers Inc and Credit Lyonnais Securities Inc.
